description: Construction of part first, second and third floor level extensions; construction of a two storey extension to form the fourth and fifth floor level;  external alteration (following part demolition of the rear of 33-57 New Broadway) and excavation to create a basement for associated retail and plant; conversion of the upper floors from Language School (Use Class D1) to (Use Class C3) provide a total of 52 residential units from first to fifth floor levels; provision of 1,509sqm of retail floor space at the ground and basement floor (Use Class A1); and two first floor level (east and west) communal deck amenity areas at the rear.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Site Location Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)001 dated 09/12/15; Site Plan, Drawing no.  AL(01)002 dated 07/11/16; Basement Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)099 Rev A dated 28/09/16; Ground Floor Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)100 Rev B dated 04/11/16; 1st Floor Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)101 dated 09/12/15; 2nd Floor Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)102 Rev A dated 22/03/17; 3rd Floor Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)103 Rev A dated 22/06/17; 4th Floor Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)104 Rev A dated 22/03/17; 5th Floor Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)105 Rev A dated 22/03/17; Roof Plan, Drawing no. AL(01)106 dated 09/12/15; North Elevation, Drawing no. AL(03)360 dated 09/12/15; West Elevation, Drawing no. AL(03)380 dated 09/12/15; South Elevation, Drawing no. AL(03)320 Rev A dated 22/03/17; East Elevation, Drawing no. AL(03)340 dated 09/12/15; Section AA', Drawing no. AL(02)220 dated 09/12/15; Drawing no. 11648/2000 rev A; Landscaping Strategy Design Development Report prepared by AutorArchitecture; Design & Access Statement prepared by Wallhill ltd; Planning and Heritage Statement prepared by Turnberry Planning dated 01/16; Historic Environment Assessment prepared by MOLA dated 29/09/15; Daylight and Sunlight Report prepared by Malcolm Hollis, Ref 44684/IM/EB dated 06/01/16; Addendum to Transport Statement prepared by Fairhurst, Report No. TA01111648.R3.1 dated 25/11/16; Travel Plan prepared by Fairhurst, Report no. 111648/R2/2 dated 25/10/15; Energy Statement prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd Issue 01 Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment dated 5/11/15; Flood Risk Assessment prepared by Fairhurst, Report no. 111648/R3/2 dated 07/10/15; Geo-Environemental & Geotechnical Preliminary Risk Assessment, Report no. 11648/R4.2 dated 07/10/15.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those as described on the plans and application documents. Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013).

| A detailed construction method statement (including the construction of the basement) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, delivery times, dust suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.

REASON: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13,  7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
| Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
-	the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;
-	loading and unloading of plant and materials;
-	storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;
-	the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate;
-	wheel washing facilities;
-	measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during demolition and construction; and
-	a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works
-	No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
-	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

REASON: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | Prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, details of refuse and recycling storage, together with an Operational Waste Management Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building and has been fully implemented and made available for use. The approved details and facilities shall be implemented as approved and retained in operation thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) and policies 5.16, and 5.17 of the London Plan (2016).

| Five (5) car parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with the submitted details including 2 disabled car spaces; 1 car space with an active electric car charging point; 1 car space with a passive electric car charging point; and 1 car spaces for servicing and deliveries.
REASON: To provide car parking to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of ninety two (92) covered secure bicycle spaces including five (5) adaptable spaces shall be provided onsite in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
-	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
-	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
-	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The rating noise level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential units shall achieve an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), 0r NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.

REASON: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development.

In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

REASON: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use. | Details of the proposed upgrades to the access laneway and rear car parking/residential entry area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site. The details shall include proposed treatment of the spaces to ensure a high quality and safe pedestrian environment for access and egress of future occupiers including visual differentiation between vehicular and pedestrian access/egress and the proposed bollard entry system.

REASON: To provide safe pedestrian and vehicular access in accordance with policies 6.10, 7.3 and 7.4, 7.13 of the London Plan (2016), policies 7.3 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan and Interim SPG 8: Safer Ealing.

| An access, delivery and servicing plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved. The plan shall cover the following:
- How access will be control and managed via the bollards
- Residential vehicular access and operation
- Deliveries and collections
- Emergency Vehicle access
- Servicing trips (including maintenance and postal vans)
- Cleaning and waste removal
- Control of vehicle movements within the internal access road and public realm
- Management and security of disabled parking
- Monitoring and review of operations

The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policy 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and Local Variation policy 6.13 of the Development Management DPD 2013.

| 10% of the residential units shall be provided to Wheelchair Adaptable / Wheelchair Accessible Standards and such provision shall be provided across a mix of units and tenures within the development. The details of such provision shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in accordance with the requirements of condition 4 of this permission. The Wheelchair Accessible /Wheelchair Adaptable units included within each phase of the development shall be provided prior to first occupation of the relevant phase.

REASON: To provide housing opportunities for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with policies: 3.5, 3.8, and 3.9 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and Local Variation policy 3.5 of the Development Management DPD 2013. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings containing flats hereby permitted unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policies 3.5 and 7.4 and policies 7B and 7C of the Development Management DPD 2013.
| The A1 (retail) use hereby approved at the ground floor shall not operate outside of the hours of 0600hrs to 0000hrs.

REASON: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.

| a) Prior to the first occupation of the residential units within the approved development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 01Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment (5 November 2015) prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd.

b) Prior to the first occupation of the commercial units within the approved development, the approved commercial units shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 01 and BREEAM Pre-Assessment (5 November 2015) prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd.

REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to the first occupation of the development proposing the construction of residential units, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain measures to ensure that the residential units will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day. Development shall proceed in accordance with the approved water efficiency statement.

REASON: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016. | Notwithstanding the information submitted in support of the application, prior to commencement of the development, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling, being applied to a range of dwellings including top, middle and ground floor, using the guidance and criteria provided in CIBSE TM49 & TM59 and demonstrating how these units perform against and even exceed the overheating criteria, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the dwellings to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted and evidence that these measures can be incorporated into the development if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. The dwellings shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.

REASON: To ensure that the dwellings hereby approved are energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013). | a) Within three-months of the first occupation of each dwelling and non-residential units in the approved development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER/BER and TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

b) Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings and non-residential units, technical information and evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

c) Prior to the final completion of each component including residential and non-residential units , the approved scheme shall incorporate, maintain measures and be designed to connect to an offsite district heating network to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.56% (equal to 32 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 01 (3 November 2017) and supplementary information (November 2017), prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd:

i.	energy saving measures and gas fired communal heating system to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 14 tonnes CO2 equating to 15.6% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

ii.	incorporation of at least 47kWp solar PV system and Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 18 tonnes CO2 equating to 24% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

REASON: To ensure that the dwellings within the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | All boilers accommodated in the plant room to serve the energy requirements of the development should use Ultra low-NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| A detailed landscape plan for hard and soft landscaping including boundary treatment shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site. The plan shall include final details of the 1.7m high angled metal balustrades at the boundaries to screen and mitigate any potential for overlooking of adjoining properties.

REASON: To ensure that the development does not result in any net loss of tress in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.10 of the London Plan (2016).

| A detailed landscape plan for hard and soft landscaping including boundary treatment shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site.

REASON: To ensure that the development does not result in any net loss of tress in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.10 of the London Plan (2016).

| Detailed design, maintenance plans as per the Flood Risk Assessment issued in October 2015 (ref.111648/R3/2) and dwg 11648/2000 rev A shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site.

REASON: To ensure that the archaeological features are protected, in accordance with policies 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policies 5.12 of the London Plan (2016).

| No demolition or development shall take place until a written scheme of Archaeological investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, which shall include the statement of significance and research objectives, and:
a)	The programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

b)	The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. this part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the WSI.
REASON: To ensure that the archaeological features are protected, in accordance with policies 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and policies 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
